solution: This error occurs when a pointer is used before being initialized. Ensure the pointer is allocated with new or assigned a valid reference before access.
Multiple goroutines are accessing shared data without synchronization. Protect shared state using mutexes or channels to ensure safe access.
A channel must only be closed by the sender and only once. Track ownership of the channel or use a sync.Once to prevent multiple close calls.
Deadlocks happen when goroutines wait on each other indefinitely. Always lock mutexes in a consistent order and avoid holding locks longer than necessary.
This panic occurs when accessing a slice or array index outside its bounds. Check slice length before indexing and validate loop conditions.
